greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal representation of n interpreted in base b+1, where b=A054055(n) is the largest digit in decimal representation of n.
comment: a(n) = n iff n < 10 OR n is a "9ish number": a(A011539(n)) = A011539(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 29 2011
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11000
mathematica: a[n_] := (id = IntegerDigits[n] // Reverse; b = Max[id]+1; id.b^Range[0, Length[id]-1]); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 75}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 15 2013 *)
program: a068505 n = foldr (\d v -> v * b + d) 0 dds where
(PARI) a(n)=my(d = digits(n), b = vecmax(d)); subst(Pol(d), x, b+1); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 12 2016
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 11 2002, Feb 23 2008
ext: Definition clarified and comment corrected by _Martin Büttner_, Feb 02 2016
